definition: local accent/accent of one's native place
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Her strong local accent betrayed her hometown.
sentences.chinese: 口浓浓的乡音可以知道她的家乡。

sentences.english: She often speaks with a strong local accent.
sentences.chinese: 她说话经常带浓重的乡音。

sentences.english: He was frequently mtext ade fun of for his strong accent.
sentences.chinese: 由于他乡音重，大家常和他开玩笑。

sentences.english: He speaks in his broad accent.
sentences.chinese: 他说话带有很重的乡音。

sentences.english: He was often made fun of for his strong accent.
sentences.chinese: 由于他乡音很重，大家常和他开玩笑。

sentences.english: She often speaks with a strong local accent .
sentences.chinese: 她说话经常带浓厚的乡音。

definition: person living or traveling far from home
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
native soil/one's native land/one's hometown/local (to an area)
foreign land/a place far from home
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
